brainly_data.question: What is one limitation of using the jawbreaker as a model for Earth's layers? A. The layers are all made out of the same material. B. The outside layer is the thinnest layer. C. The jawbreaker has four different layers. D. The jawbreaker can be split to show the inside.
brainly_data.subject: Physics

all_answers.question: What is one limitation of using the jawbreaker as a model for Earth's layers? A. The layers are all made out of the same material. B. The outside layer is the thinnest layer. C. The jawbreaker has four different layers. D. The jawbreaker can be split to show the inside.
all_answers.subject: Physics
all_answers.text: The layers of a jawbreaker is all made of the same material. The layers of the Earth are not, it is made of different kinds of rock, magma, and metal is inside of the core

top_answer.subject: Physics
top_answer.text: The layers of a jawbreaker is all made of the same material. The layers of the Earth are not, it is made of different kinds of rock, magma, and metal is inside of the core
